intro: Japarandiba antillana, commonly known as the Antillean hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in wetlands or along riverbanks. Japarandiba antillana is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been used in traditional medicine in some parts of its native range.
